subject: A Casting We Will Go
event: Well, Reuters has the story out already, so there's no longer any reason for me to keep mum. Yes, the rumors you've been seeing all over the web the last few days are true. Another huge piece has fallen into place for the HBO pilot of A GAME OF THRONES -- we have signed Sean Bean to play the part of Lord Eddard Stark. For the movie fans out there, Sean Bean needs no introduction. I mean, what the hell, he was Boromir and he was Sharpe, he was terrific in both roles, and in a hundred other parts besides. I can't imagine a better Ned. The deal took some doing, so my fingers have been crossed for a month now (and boy, that made it hard to type), but now it's done, and I'm thrilled. That's only part of the exciting news, however. Casting has been proceeding apace these past six weeks or so -- in New York and LA, London and Dublin, most recently in Australia. David and Dan and director Tom McCarthy have been looking all over the world for the right actors, and now they've filled some key roles as well. For King Robert I Baratheon, we've got Mark Addy, a veteran British actor of stage and screen that many of you may remember from his fine turn in A KNIGHT'S TALE. The roles of Joffrey Baratheon, the crown prince, and Viserys Targaryen, the beggar king, have also been filled... by Jack Gleeson and Harry Lloyd, respectively. Sorry, I haven't been able to find pictures of them on the internet yet, though I'm sure they are out there somewhere. I've seen readings by both Gleeson and Lloyd, and both should be terrific. And last, but certainly not least, the role of the bastard Jon Snow will be played by a young actor named Kit Harington. You probably haven't heard of him yet... but you will, we're confident. David and Dan can't say enough about his talent and intensity. Of course, there's a lot more roles still to fill, including some very crucial ones like the Lannister twins, the Stark children, and Daenerys Targaryen, so the search will continue for awhile. But we've begun, and so far I couldn't be happier. October is right around the corner.

comments.article: this is soooo exciting!  Except that Sean Bean will only be in it for the first season... oh well..
Doesn't his head show up again in the second book?  And are there any flashback scenes?  I can't remember.

I love it!  Sean Bean will be a great Eddard, and that kid who I've admittedly never heard of looks very much like my idea of Jon Snow.  (He also resembles the Jon Snow from the 2009 Calendar).  The series is going to rock.  It will be picked up by HBO, win a bunch of awards, bring a ton of new fans to the books, GWB will be convicted of war crimes, and all will be well with the world.  Yay!
Hooray!!!!
YAAAAAAY!!! *Snoopy Dance! Snoopy Dance!*
AWESOME news, George!
exciting news! great casting as far as I'm concerned.

Sean f'in Bean.

Seven hells yes.

comments.upictitle: For all your sophisticated Cock-Tailing needs: ASOIAF-Jon&Ghost
comments.article:
That's some brilliant, inspired casting! And the young Mr Kit looks perfect to portray my favorite bastard. :-D

Very exciting stuff! Can't wait to see who else they cast!

(ETA: I should add that I'd LOVE to see Kevin McKidd (Rome, Journeyman) as Jamie Lannister. :) )

I totally agree with you, Kevin McKidd would make a terrific Jaime! :D
BTW, I love the cast of characters so far!!!
Every time you update, I get even more excited! We'll definitely be ordering HBO for the premiere!
This rocks so much I can't adequately describe my glee in words.
Nice. But... Sad what we have no HBO broadcasting in Russia.
October is right around the corner. Yes it is! All this is great news, George! Thanks for keeping us updated.
October is right around the corner Yes... winter is coming
Is it Sean Bean's karma to play characters who are killed before the end of the movie?

comments.upictitle: You'll have to speak up, I'm wearing a towel: iRaq
comments.article: Well after the Sharpe series, where Sharpe was unkillable... I'd say yes. :D He's got a lot of dying to make up for.
Yay for Sean Bean! But now I'll never want the first season to end. And Mark Addy too, that's awesome. I can't wait to see the rest of the cast.
mark addy...as robert...awesome? That guy is a 5'something teddy bear...why not cast jonas hiller and make the part a complete farce.
comments.subject: Robert.

comments.article: Thanks for the update!  I just finished rereading the whole series, plus the two Dunk and Egg tales earlier tonight, so this news is most welcome as I wait for your next tale! :)

yay!!!!! that's awesome :D

i really really hope HBO doesn't mess this up.. like they have done to a few wonderful series in the past.
that's gonna be one of the best TV-shows ever
There is not enough bandwidth on all the Internet to contain my SQUEE! This is fantastic news! I am so excited to see this come to life.

comments.subject: Kurtwood Smith?

comments.article:
Great news! I've been hoping for it to come true since I've heard the rumors about Sean Bean involvement for the first time.
Just a pity, that he's got to die here as well.
Except for a few roles, he's always tragically dies in the movies...
